alert.note: Alert for City of Fredericksburg; Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 9:16AM EST until January 11 at 10:42AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg affecting City of Fredericksburg, Stafford and Spotsylvania independent cities. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Water reaches the waterfront at Fredericksburg City Dock. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 7.0 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Thu Thu Fri Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1PM 7PM 1AM Stg Time Date Rappahannock River Fredericksburg 13.0 MSG unknown 8.6 6.3 5.6 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1045 AM EST.
